TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy-skeletal, mixed Typic Humicryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Matcher stony sandy loam, forested.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
01--3 to 1 inch; undecomposed organic material, mainly needles, bark, and twigs.
02--1 inch to 0; partially decomposed organic material.
A1--0 to 9 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) stony sandy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; moderate fine crumb structure; soft, very friable; 20 percent stones; slightly acid; abrupt smooth boundary.  (5 to 12 inches thick)
B21--9 to 13 inches; reddish gray (5YR 5/2) very stony sandy loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/2) moist; moderate fine crumb structure; slightly hard, very friable; 60 percent stones; medium acid; clear smooth boundary.  (2 to 7 inches thick)
B22--13 to 18 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/4) very stony sandy loam, reddish brown (5YR 4/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure that parts to strong very fine subangular blocks; slightly hard, very friable; 60 percent stones; medium acid; clear smooth boundary.  (3 to 9 inches thick)
B3--18 to 22 inches; yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) very stony loamy sand, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; single grained; loose; 60 percent stones; slightly acid; clear smooth boundary.  (2 to 6 inches thick)
C--22 to 60 inches; light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) very stony sand, olive brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; single grained; loose; 60 percent cobbles and stones; slightly acid.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Gunnison County, Colorado; near the junction of Middle and South Quartz Creeks; 1,000 feet south of the road junction in Sec.  12, T. 50 N., R. 4 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Thickness of the umbric epipedon ranges from 7 to 15 inches, thickness of the solum ranges from 12 to 30 inches, and depth to the sand and gravel substratum ranges from 20 to 40 inches.  Organic carbon in the umbric epipedon ranges from .7 to 4 percent.  Rock fragments range from 35 to 80 percent by volume in the control section and are dominantly more than 10 inches in diameter.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1.5 through 3.  Reaction ranges from slightly acid to very strongly acid.  Usually this horizon has fine crumb structure but it has weak subangular blocky structure in some pedons.  Dry consistence is soft or slightly hard.
The B2 horizon has hue of 7.5YR through 2.5YR, value of 5 or 6 dry, 3 through 5 moist, and chroma of 3 through 6.  Reaction ranges from medium acid to very strongly acid.
The C horizon has hue of 10YR or 2.5Y.  Reaction ranges from slightly acid to strongly acid.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Buell, Gramm, Hossick, and Penitente series, all of which have loamy-skeletal control sections.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  The Matcher soils are on mountain slopes and glacial moraines above 8,500 feet.  Typically they are in areas bordering the alpine areas.  Slope gradients range from 2 to 50 percent.   The soils formed in very stony coarse to moderately coarse textured slightly acid glacial till or outwash.  At the type location the average annual precipitation is 20 inches with generally uniform precipitation occurring throughout the year.  The mean annual temperature is 34 degrees F. and the frost-free season is 45 to 75 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Darling, Leal, and Rarick soils, all of which have less than 35 percent rock fragments in the control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; slow runoff; rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for forestry, for rangeland, and for recreational purposes.  Native vegetation is mainly lodgepole pine, spruce, and fir with an understory of prostrate juniper, whortleberry, and kinnikinnick.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  High mountain areas of central Colorado.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Last updated by the state 6/75.
